info.description:
The Crime Data API enables you to explore data from the FBI Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) program. This is data the FBI collects from law state and local law enforcement agencies and is used to compile the Crime in the US annual reports since 1960. The program is voluntary and not all agencies participate. In addition, data is often published publicly about 18 months after it is submitted to the FBI. This means that the most recent year for data in the API is 2015.

This site and API are in beta, which means we're actively working on both and adding new features. While we plan to version big changes that are not backwards compatible, expect things to change as the API develops. This might mean that the structure of endpoints could shift around or that the accepted parameters are changed. All noteable changes to the API are recorded in the [CHANGELOG](https://github.com/fbi-cde/crime-data-api/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).

The API is a read-only web service that returns JSON or CSV data. It is broadly organized around the data reporting systems the FBI UCR program uses and their related entities. Agencies submit data using one of two reporting formats -- the Summary Reporting System (SRS), or the National Incident Based Reporting System (NIBRS). SRS data is the legacy format that provides aggregated counts of the reported crime offenses known to law enforcement by location.

NIBRS is a newer format that provides an incident-based view of crime. It includes information about each offense, such as the time of day an incident occurred, the demographics of the offenders/victims, the known relationships between the offenders and victims, and many other details around how and where crime occurs. Neither format includes personally identifiable information (PII) about the offenders or victims. While many agencies submit SRS data, the FBI plans to transition all crime reporting to the NIBRS format by 2021.

Other UCR data collection systems made available by this API include:

* Supplemental homicide report (SHR)
* Cargo theft
* Hate crimes
* Human trafficking
* Assaults on law enforcement officers
* Law enforcement agency personnel demographic data
There is a lot of data, but a good place to start is by looking at the rate of a particular crime over the last 10 years in a state or Washington, DC.
Let's try it with homicide in Washington, DC for from 2004 through 2014.  find crime rates, we will use the /counts endpoint passing in parameters to represent the crime type (homicide) and the years in question. Here's the API request the Crime Data Explorer makes to display this data:

`/counts?explorer_offense=homicide&per_page=11&year>=2004&year<=2014&state=dc`

We can use the `explorer_offense` parameter to just get data related to homicide crimes. If you do not supply an offense, you'll get data that represents all the crime types in that location. Next we set our `per_page` parameter to be 11, since we'll be requesting 11 years at once. We do this to ensure that we only need to make one request to get all of the data. We craft a date range query by supply two `year` parameters using greater than and less than operators in the URL. Finally, we supply the location that we want data for. If `state` is omitted, the data will represent the national perspective.

Get an API key here. That will enable you to place up to XX requests per minute. Each call is limited to YY results per page. You can email questions or comments to EE. You can ask questions or give us feedback using Github issues.

The model definitions and schema are available at [/swagger.json](/swagger.json). This is useful for making wrappers and exploring the data.

The API was designed to provide as much information as possible in a usable format. However, the FBI still has some recommendations about how to interpret and display the data provided. The FBI strongly advises against using this data to do any sort of ranking or comparison among states or other entities. The exception being that it is appropriate to compare a city to its respective state, and that state to a national perspective.

View our [source code](https://github.com/fbi-cde/crime-data-api). We welcome issues and pull requests!
info.title: FBI Crime Data API

fieldsParam.name: fields
fieldsParam.description: Limit response to specific fields only

perPageParam.name: per_page
perPageParam.description: How many results to show per page. You might want to make this large for CSV downloads

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: Which page of results to show

incidentCountGroupByParam.name: by
incidentCountGroupByParam.description: Counts can be provided for statistics grouped by a list of one or more parameters

outputParam.name: output
outputParam.description: The format to return results in

yearParam.name: year
yearParam.description: Use this field to limit results to a single year. Note that a range can be specified by using the comparison operators and multiple arguments like `&year>2000&year<2010`

monthParam.name: month
monthParam.description: Use this field to limit results to the specified month. Multiple months can be specified with multiple query parameters or by using comparison operators in the query

stateParam.name: state
stateParam.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

oriParam.name: ori
oriParam.description: Search by ORI for the agency. Since ORIs are unique, it might make more sense to use the /agencies/:ori endpoint

agencyNameParam.name: agency_name
agencyNameParam.description: The name of the agency. Currently only supports exact matches.

tribeIdParam.name: tribe_id
tribeIdParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific tribe. Use the `/codes/ref_tribe` API call to get a list of tribes

campusIdParam.name: campus_id
campusIdParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific university campus.

cityNameParam.name: city_name
cityNameParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific city name. This supports exact matches only and you should combine it with the `state_abbr`.

stateAbbrParam.name: state_abbr
stateAbbrParam.description: Find agencies within a specific state by its postal abbreviation.

populationGroupCodeParam.name: population_group_code
populationGroupCodeParam.description: The population group code is used to classify agencies by size of population served. To see the list of all codes, see `/codes/ref_population_group`

agencyOriParam.name: agency_ori
agencyOriParam.description: The ORI of the agency. You can provide multiple arguments.

reportedParam.name: reported
reportedParam.description: If the agency has reported either SRS or NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

reportedNibrsParam.name: reported_nibrs
reportedNibrsParam.description: If the agency has reported either NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

monthsReportedParam.name: months_reported
monthsReportedParam.description: Months in a year that the agency has reported either SRS or NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

monthsReportedNibrsParam.name: nibrs_months_reported
monthsReportedNibrsParam.description: Months in a year that an agency has reported NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

statePathParam.name: state_abbr
statePathParam.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

fipsPathParam.name: fips_code
fipsPathParam.description: The 5-character FIPS code for a county

oriPathParam.name: ori
oriPathParam.description: The ORI for finding a single agency

codeTablePathParam.name: code_table_id
codeTablePathParam.description: The name of the code table to return the values for

victimsCountVariableParam.name: variable
victimsCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group victim counts by

victimsCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
victimsCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group victim counts by

offendersCountVariableParam.name: variable
offendersCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offender counts by

offendersCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
offendersCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offender counts by for within the specified offense

offensesCountVariableParam.name: variable
offensesCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offense counts by

cargoTheftsCountVariableParam.name: variable
cargoTheftsCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group cargo_theft counts by

cargoTheftsCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
cargoTheftsCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group cargo_theft counts by

hateCrimesCountVariableParam.name: variable
hateCrimesCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group hate_crime counts by

offenseCategoryParam.name: offense_category
offenseCategoryParam.description: The names of SRS offense categories to search against

offenseNameParam.name: offense_name
offenseNameParam.description: A specific name for an offense in NIBRS

explorerOffenseParam.name: explorer_offense
explorerOffenseParam.description: For the convenience of the Crime Data Explorer, this method takes a generic crime offense name and searches against the specific SRS or NIBRS offense in the backend models

ori.description: The ORI is a unique identifier for retrieving the agency

legacy_ori.description: If the agency had a different ORI in the past, it will be stored here. Otherwise, it will be the same as the ORI.

short_name.description: A shorter name for the agency

agency_type_id.description: A code for the type of the agency

agency_type_name.description: A string description of the agency type

tribe_id.description: Identifier for a tribe in the `ref_tribe` table if the agency is associated with a tribe

campus_id.description: Identifier for a campus in `ref_university_campus` table if the agency is associated ith a university campus.

city_name.description: The name of the city associated with the agency.

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal abbrevation for the associated state

primary_county.description: The name of the main county that the agency is located within

primary_county_fips.description: The 5-character FIPS code for the primary county

agency_status.description: A code for the agency status

submitting_sai.description: The SAI for the entity that submitted records for this agency

submitting_name.description: The name of the entity that submitted records for this agency

submitting_state_abbr.description: The state of the entity that submitted records for this agency

start_year.description: The earliest records in the database for this specific ORI. Note that agencies may have participated in the UCR program earlier and under other ORI.

dormant_year.description: The year a specific agency went dormant

revised_rape_start.description: The year the agency started reporting rapes using the new definition that was revised in 2013. Agencies can switch over at any time to the new definition during the indicated year and rapes reported that year will be a mix of the old and new definition. NULL indicates the agency has not switched over yet.

current_nibrs_start_year.description: If the agency is currently reporting 12 months of NIBRS data to the FBI, this is the first year that current run of reporting NIBRS data started. Because there are many agencies that reported NIBRS data in 1991 then stopped for many years before resuming in the 2000s, this is a better measure than the first year of NIBRS reporting.

current_year.description: The most recent year there is population and other demographic data for the agency.

population.description: The reported population for an agency. Note that the UCR definition of `population` is often smaller than the actual population that might be within an agency's jurisdiction and in many cases may be 0 Exercise caution when calculating rates with this number.

population_group_code.description: The code for the agency's population group

population_group_desc.description: A description of the agency's population group

population_source_flag.description: A source flag for the agency's population number

suburban_area_flag.description: Is the agency in a suburb

core_city_flag.description: Is the agency a core_city agency?

months_reported.description: How many months the agency reported either SRS or NIBRS in the current_year

nibrs_months_reported.description: How many months the agency reported either NIBRS in the current_year

past_10_years_reported.description: A count of how  many of the 10 most recent years of SRS data this agency reported 12 months of crime dats to the FBI.

covered_by_ori.description: The ORI of another agency that covered reporting for this agency in the current_year

covered_by_name.description: The name of the agency that covered reporting for this agency in the current_year

staffing_year.description: The last year this agency reported staffing numbers to the FBI

total_officers.description: The total number of officers reported for the staffing_year

total_civilians.description: The total number of civilian employees reported for the staffing_year

icpsr_zip.description: A zip code for the agency from the ICPSR 2012 crosswalk

icpsr_lat.description: A geocoded decimal latitude for the agency from the ICPSR 2012 crosswalk. Locations will be approximate and may be the centroid for the locality.

icpsr_lng.description: A geocoded decimal longitude for the ageny from the ICPSR 2012 crosswalk. Locations will be approximate and may be the centroid for the locality.

NationalArrestCounts.description: Estimated arrest statistics for the United States

year.description: The year the counts are for

population.description: The total population for the United States in that year

total_arrests.description: Total arrests. Does not include suspicion.

rape.description: The rape figure in this table is an aggregate total of the data submitted based on both the legacy and revised Uniform Crime Reporting definitions.

violent_crime.description: Violent crimes are offenses of murder and nonnegligent manslaughter, rape, robbery, and aggravated assault.

property_crime.description: Property crimes are offenses of burglary, larceny-theft, motor vehicle theft, and arson.

against_family.description: Offenses against the family and children

SummaryCount.description: Several endpoints in the Crime Data Explorer return aggregated counts related to the offense.

year.description: Usually counts are aggregated on an annual basis among other measures. This field contains the year the counts are valid for.

reported.description: How many incidents were reported for the specified offense.

actual.description: The number of reported incidents that were deemed credible.

unfounded.description: The number of reported incidents that were deemed unfounded. This should add up with `actual` to return the total number of reported offenses.

cleared.description: The number of incidents that were cleared by law enforcement. Note that clearances are counted in the year they are made and not added to previous years for old cases.

juvenile_cleared.description: The number of clearances made that involved a juvenile (generally someone < 18 years old)

ArsonSummary.description: Represents arson counts for a specific year returned by the arson endpoints.

year.description: The year the count is from

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal abbreviation of the state the arson count is for. May be NULL for nationwide counts

ori.description: For arson requests at the agency level, returns the ORI for the agency. Always null for statewide and national counts

subcategory_code.description: For counts taken at the subcategory level, this is the code for the subcategory. Otherwise, null.

subcategory_name.description: For counts at the subcategory level, this returns a description for the subcategory of structure affected. Otherwise, null.

uninhabited.description: The number of affected buildings that were uninhabited.

est_damage_value.description: Estimated damage in dollars from the arson cases in that year.

year.description: The year of the estimated counts

population.description: Populations are U.S. Census Bureau provisional estimates as of July 1 for each year except 2000 and 2010, which are decennial census counts.

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal abbreviation if these estimates are for a specific state

violent_crime.description: The violent crime figures include the offenses of murder, rape (legacy definition), robbery, and aggravated assault.

property_crime.description: The total of all property crime categories

caveats.description: Caveats provided by the FBI related to the estimates for that specific year. Note that a lack of caveats does not that other precautions for working with the data don't apply.

classification.description: A classification of the criminal offenses

year.description: The year an agency is reporting human trafficking numbers for

population.description: The population served by the agency in the year of its report. Because of how the UCR program uniquely apportions populations to agencies, this number may be significantly lower than the actual population that lies within the agency's jurisdiction or even 0

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal code for the state

sex_acts_cleared.description: Total cleared cases, commercial sex acts

sex_acts_juvenile_cleared.description: Total juvenile cleared cases, commercial sex acts

servitude_juvenile_cleared.description: Total juvenile cleared cases, involuntary servitude

months_reported.description: How many months in the year all participating agencies within the given state reported human trafficking statistics to the FBI. To get an average number of months reported by each agency, you can divide by the agencies parameter

agencies.description: The number of agencies reporting in the given state and year

months_reported.description: How many months the agency reported human trafficking statistics to the FBI. The FBI includes counts from agencies that have not reported a full year, and you should avoid extrapoliting annual counts from a partial year of reporting.

year.description: The year these participation details are for

state_name.description: The name of the state the agency is located in

state_abbr.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

agency_population.description: The unique population within the jurisdiction for the agency. The FBI UCR program does not overlap populations even though agency jurisdictions might overlap. This means that some agencies like state highway patrols or transit police might be assigned a population of 0, and that is not a bug

population_group_code.description: The FBI code for the population group the agency belongs to. For a full listing of all population codes, call the `/codes/ref_population_group`

population_group.description: The name for the population group the agency belongs to

reported.description: This is 1 if agency reported either SRS or NIBRS at least once in the given year

months_reported.description: How many months the agency filed a crime report in the given year

nibrs_reported.description: This is 1 if agency reported to NIBRS at least once in the given year

nibrs_months_reported.description: How many months the agency filed a NIBRS crime report in the given year

year.description: The year that these participation statistics were calculated for

participating_agencies.description: How many agencies either reported crime or were covered by another agency that reported

total_agencies.description: The total number of agencies for the specific year

participation_rate.description: A rate of which agencies have filed either an SRS or NIBRS report in the given year

total_population.description: The sum of the population within the jurisdictions of all agencies for that year

participating_population.description: The sum of the population within the jurisdictions of all agencies that participated for that year

nibrs_participating_agencies.description: The number of agencies who filed a NIBRS report in the given year or were covered by another agency that filed NIBRS

nibrs_participation_rate.description: A rate of how many agencies filed a NIBRS report in a given year

nibrs_participating_population.description: The sum of the population within the jurisdictions of all agencies that participated in NIBRS for that year

CountForYear.description: This object will almost always include an additional variable field with the value of the variable being counted. So. if you asked the API for counts related to `race_code` variable, each record would have a key like `race_code` and the corresponding value (ie, `B`, `W`) etc. for that count.

year.description: The year for which the counts were computed

count.description: A count for a specific value of a variable in a given year

CargoTheftCountForYear.description: Cargo theft counts also include dollar estimates for the values of stolen and recovered property

stolen_value.description: The total estimated value for stolen property in that count

recovered_value.description: The total estimated value for recovered property in that count

GeoCountyBasicInfo.description: Basic information about the county, as returned within the response for the /geo/states endpoint.

county_id.description: The internal identifier for the county within the CDE database

fips.description: The five character numeric code used to identify the county under the FIPS standards. The UCR database also contains multiple special unmapped counties that hold statewide and tribal entities that do not belong to real counties. These will have a FIPS code of NULL.

GeoStateDetail.description: The record of metadata returned by the /geo/states/<state_abbr> endpoint to describe a single state

current_year.description: The most recent year of data for the state

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal abbreviation for the state

total_population.description: The reported population for the state in the current_year

total_agencies.description: The total number of agencies in the state in the current_year

participating_agencies.description: The number of agencies in the current year that either reported 12 months of data or were covered by another agency that reported for 12 months

participation_pct.description: The percentage of agencies the participated in the current year

nibrs_participating_agencies.description: The number of agencies that reported 12 months of NIBRS data or were covered by an agency that reported NIBRS data in the current year

nibrs_participation_pct.description: The percentage of agencies the participated in NIBRS for the current year

covered_agencies.description: The number of agencies that were covered by another agency (i.e., the covering agency included counts for the covered agencies in its own statistics) in the current year

covered_pct.description: The percentage of agencies that were covered by other agencies in the current year

participating_population.description: The total populations of all agencies that participated in the current year. Note that this should be used as an approximate measure of reporting coverage rather than an exact number.

participating_population_pct.description: The percentage of the state population that is within participating agencies. Since the UCR program assigns populations in a special way, this should be used as an approximate heuristic rather than an exact statistic.

nibrs_participating_population.description: The total populations of all agencies that participated in NIBRS for the current year. Note that this should be used as an approximate measure of reporting coverage rather than an exact number.

nibrs_population_pct.description: The percentage of the state population that is within NIBRS participating agencies. Since the UCR program assigns populations in a special way, this should be used as an approximate heuristic rather than an exact statistic.

police_officers.description: The number of police officers reported by agencies in the current year. Not all agencies report their staffing every year.

civilian_employees.description: The number of civilian employees reported by agencies in the current year. Not all agencies report their staffing every year.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of agencies.

200.description: For success, returns a paginated list of agencies.

get.description: Returns a single agency by ORI

200.description: For success, returns a single agency.

get.description: Returns annual counts of estimated arrests nationwide per each year.

200.description: Returns a paginated list of national arrest counts

get.description: Returns annual counts of arsons nationwide per each year.

200.description: Returns a paginated list of arson counts

get.description: Returns counts of arsons in a given state per year.

200.description: Returns a paginated list of arson counts

get.description: The codes endpoint returns a listing of all the code lookup tables for codes that are used throughout the crime data explorer. Certain API endpoints will return either the codes or their corresponding values. This endpoint returns a dictionary mapping code table names to URLs for their lookup

This endpoint returns a list of values for a given code lookup table within the crime data explorer. Other API endpoints may return either the codes or their corresponding value in a given record, so this endpoints provides a comprehensive list of all possible values that you might expect to see. The actual structure of each result will vary depending on the code table you are requesting.
This endpoint returns national estimates from the API
This endpoint returns national estimates from the API
Returns basic information about the state
Returns just the participation data for a state

200.description: For success, return a paginated list of participation stats. Note that if you request `output=csv`, you probably want to also make `per_page` sufficiently large to include all data.
For success, return a paginated list of agency participation detail. With no parameters, this can get quite large, but you can provide filters to limit to specific fields.
Returns a paginated list of statistics for nationwide participation per year in revers chronological order

get.description: Returns a paginated list of annual agency counts for human trafficking. Not all agencies submit reports nor they necessarily submit for all months of a given year. Human trafficking data has only been collected from 2013 onwards. Any field returned in the response can be used to filter down searches.

200.description: For success, returns a paginated list of agency reports on human trafficking

get.description: Returns a paginated list of state counts for human trafficking. Not all agencies submit reports nor they necessarily submit for all months of a given year. Human trafficking data has only been collected from 2013 onwards. Only reports from states and Washington, DC are included in these counts (territories are excluded). Any field returned in the response can be use to filter down searches.

200.description: For success, returns a paginated list of state totals on human trafficking

tags.name: cargo theft
tags.description: The FBI collects statistics about cargo theft

tags.name: hate crimes
tags.description: These API endpoints return data about hate crimes that have been reported to the FBI UCR program.

tags.name: human trafficking
tags.description: These endpoints return statistics about human trafficking reported into the FBI since 2013

tags.name: estimates
tags.description: These endpoints return estimated annual counts for crime categories reported as part of the annual `Crime in the United States` reports.

tags.name: national
tags.description: These API methods provide nationwide counts of crime

tags.name: trends
tags.description: Top-level trends for the national and state levels

tags.name: participation
tags.description: These API endpoints provide data on participation. This may mean either specific reports on if a given agency has filed crime reports to the SRS or NIBRS system in a given year or aggregated data on how many agencies within a state or county or city have filed SRS reports or NIBRS.

tags.name: meta
tags.description: These API endpoints return data about the crime data explorer database and its code values rather than specific crime statistics.

tags.name: nibrs summaries
tags.description: These endpoints return summarized counts for specific variables within the NIBRS sub-tables. This is what is used to populate the detailed histograms of offenders, offenses, victims and other types of information on the crime data explorer for states with agencies that participate in the NIBRS program. You must provide a variable argument as part of the call, but these endpoints will return counts of how many times each value occurred for a variable in a given year. For instance, using the `race_code` variable with the `count/victims` endpoint will return a count of how many victims of each race_code were in a given year. The `/offenses` API methods provide grouped counts for a specified variable, but only for incidents related to a single offense. For instance, the call `count/victims/states/OH/race_code?explorer_offense=aggravated-assault` would be used to get annual histograms of the race codes for victims of aggravated assault only.

tags.name: state
tags.description: These endpoints provide data for state-level views of crime
